newsitem.title: USA: ValueVision Q4 net falls on higher costs.
newsitem.headline: ValueVision Q4 net falls on higher costs.

text.p: ValueVision International Inc said Thursday higher costs associated with producing and marketing its home shopping operation contributed to a decline in net income in the fourth quarter.

The company reported net income of $882,000, or $0.03 a share, in the period ended January 31, down from $3.2 million, or $0.11 a share, a year ago. The 1996 figure included a $2.0 million gain from affiliate earnings, the company said.
ValueVision also reported sales of $65.2 million in the quarter, more than double sales one year ago of $27.2 million.
ValueVision shares were off 3/16 Thursday at 4.
